item.title: 345 – 焼きそば (Yakisoba)
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: 焼きそば (Yakisoba) This bowl of noodles thrown together with carrots, ginger, shitake, slivered beef, sloshed in a slurry of spice and sauces. A chaos of taste and color erupts out of small bowls emptied. Mise en place in Japanese fools Google into introduction, … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
焼きそば (Yakisoba)

This bowl of noodles thrown
together with carrots, ginger, shitake,
slivered beef, sloshed in a slurry of spice
and sauces. A chaos of taste and color
erupts out of small bowls emptied.
Mise en place in Japanese
fools Google into introduction,
which tastes so appropriate
paired with chilled sake. 
My tiny kitchen opened up
by scallions on the bias, tamari
and a hint of toasted sesame, lingering.

item.title: 344 – Advent
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Advent Holy Spirit is playing it cool– no fire, no prophetic voice, just wind over water, just these black scratches and the groaning they make. Whole world groaning. What to be done but wait? March, holler, get sent up? Maybe. … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Advent

Holy Spirit is playing it cool–
no fire, no prophetic voice,
just wind over water, just
these black scratches
and the groaning they make.
Whole world groaning.
What to be done but wait?
March, holler, get sent up?
Maybe. Made a martyr? No
good comes. Only more groaning
noise-making waiting on an answer,
return, cashing in these chips.
Wait patient, expectant breath
held, knees bent, palms up.

item.title: 343 – Stood Up
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Stood Up I’ve kept my side of the bargain. Made tea, turned off the radio, settled in to sit quietly on the couch. Waiting for her to bring words of wisdom or tragedy, some stirring retort to recent evils or comfort … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Stood Up

I’ve kept my side of the bargain.
Made tea, turned off the radio, settled in
to sit quietly on the couch. Waiting
for her to bring words of wisdom or tragedy,
some stirring retort to recent evils
or comfort in light of silence.
What flame might she light, I wonder.
I wait patiently for half an hour, more.
I try to breathe calmly, like an ocean,
and not tap my pen to my worried lip.
Soon all I have is rain-sluiced sun
and darkness pulled along by a slim thread
of geese wailing their way home.
I finish my tea and  begin to think
of making dinner for one. Perhaps
she’ll show tomorrow.

item.title: 342 – The Torture Report
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: The Torture Report John McLaughlin must have had has his hands tied (metaphorically) steering around issues of ethics, driving at law and national security lamenting making a “few” “terrorists” “uncomfortable” for “a while” I (metaphorically) add my (literal) moral outrage to a … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
The Torture Report

John McLaughlin must have had has his hands tied

(metaphorically) steering around issues of ethics, driving at law and national security

lamenting making a “few” “terrorists” “uncomfortable” for “a while”

I (metaphorically) add my (literal) moral outrage to a stack of junk mail

at a dinner party of mixed company I mention the “so-called” Torture Report

and am (metaphorically/literally) brushed aside

somewhere a (literal) man hangs from his one good wrist

item.title: 341 – Then the man I’ve just met…
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Then the man I’ve just met pauses, wipes his mouth, and says Indians. He points to his forehead, for clarity. We are eating pho in a busy Vietnamese restaurant in the north of the city. I nod as if I … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Then the man I’ve just met pauses, wipes his mouth, and says Indians. He points to his forehead, for clarity. We are eating pho in a busy Vietnamese restaurant in the north of the city. I nod as if I understand. I keep my face to myself. Indians, he says again, shaking his head. Don’t smile. Plus, they took our jobs. No offense, he says, I just couldn’t stand it, so we moved. And here we are.

And here we are.

I bend to the hot bowl of soup before me, hoping for a crash of plates, someone bumping awkwardly into us. I consider pretending to choke. But the moment passes, as it always does: quietly, on to other things. I realize driving home I wanted an ablution: seeking some kind of forgiveness in the steam of the soup. Instead we shook hands and shared some parting joke. As if nothing ever happened.

item.title: 340 – Harbor (This Morning)
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Harbor (This Morning) where ships come to find respite but never stay; not why ships are made what course, what chart will you make today? what harbor leave and new one find? among the monsters of the keening deep what … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Harbor (This Morning)

where ships come
to find respite

but never stay;
not why ships are made

what course, what chart
will you make today?

what harbor leave
and new one find?

among the monsters
of the keening deep

what flag flies
from your top-mast:

black bandit
or burning love?

call to them
see which rise.

item.title: 339 – Last Night
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Last Night Hello again, Shame-Demon rolly polly pudgster impotent grouser kniving finger-pointer who are you to… wet fear warmed over soft syllabic spookster at the edge of hearing bearing pull up a chair nail my hands to the table as … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Last Night

Hello again, Shame-Demon
rolly polly pudgster
impotent grouser kniving
finger-pointer who are you to…
wet fear warmed over
soft syllabic spookster
at the edge of hearing bearing
pull up a chair nail my hands
to the table as if I had no choice
down the bottles excess Oreos
upend the mylar bag for the last
of the congealing crumbs roll me
fetal take up residence soothe
in your wallow welcome home

item.title: 338 – advent
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: advent the darkness has/has not overcome.

item.title: 337 – Dear America
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Dear America #Blacklivesmatter is not a slogan we get to deploy while doing nothing #Dontshoot me for calling tokenism what it is: further injustice If you tweeted #Icantbreathe, prove it. Unleash your voice your body your vote your privilege to … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Dear America

#Blacklivesmatter
is not a slogan
we get to deploy
while doing nothing

#Dontshoot me
for calling tokenism
what it is:
further injustice

If you tweeted
#Icantbreathe,
prove it. Unleash
your voice

your body
your vote
your privilege
to prove #livesmatter

item.title: 336 – Blessing (Call)
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Blessing (Call) There’s no cell service here in the shadow of the mountain. I hike to the top of the rise to call your name. Moon rises sly. He brings no warmth but casts down mighty Mt. Jefferson, softens the … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Blessing (Call)

There’s no cell service
here in the shadow
of the mountain. I hike
to the top of the rise
to call your name.

Moon rises sly.
He brings no warmth
but casts down mighty
Mt. Jefferson, softens
the Sisters in their shawls. 

I hear ice in the line.
My hands blued, their blood
a thin river, frozen lifeline
holding on to the hope
of your answer.
